{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328610,"name":"Himneesh Medisetti ","username":"thatporgman612","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b9e5f3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T19:16:51.450Z","cooked":"

Trying to make a gearbox with Neos for climber in a box but we don’t have 4-1’s(website says we should use 16-1’s) we can use 5-1’s and 3-1’s to make a 15-1, is that fine?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T19:16:51.450Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458052,"topic_slug":"can-we-use-a-15-1-versaplanetary-gearbox-for-andymark-climber-in-a-box","display_username":"Himneesh Medisetti ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55836,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Chief Operations Officer"},"post_url":"/t/can-we-use-a-15-1-versaplanetary-gearbox-for-andymark-climber-in-a-box/458052/1","custom_user_title":"Chief Operations Officer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3328643,"name":"Spencer","username":"SpencerS","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/spencers/{size}/262187_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T20:21:45.710Z","cooked":"

I’ve found that the website is a very loose recommendation. If you want a 15:1, a 3:1 and a 5:1 will do that. However, it is important to test different ratios to see what works for your team. We found that 36:1 with two independent climbers was the best solution for our team and our full-weight robot.

Don’t forget to consider that you need to stay off the ground for 5 seconds after the match to get stage points, which is ultimately the reason we had to have such a high ratio.

Couple points:

  • As already mentioned, you may find you need more reduction. There are several engineeering calculators that can help you get a good starting point. Search here & you’ll find them.
  • The AM telescoping climber is good, but from the experience of using it one year, I’ll say it likes to be close to the center of mass so there is not too much side pressure between the climber tube walls from the climber not being vertical. If you can’t help locating the climber farther away from the CoM, you’ll need more power or more reduction.
